column4: OK This guide says: "Make sure an ~/.asoundrc file exists." It doesn't exist, can I just make a document in AbiWord and save it there? What format should I save in?
you can try $touch .asoundrc
Typing $touch .asoundrc returns "command not found"
try 'type touch' and tell me what you see
ok... "touch is in /usr/bin/touch"
so typing 'touch .asoundrc' doesn't work? don't type the dollar sign
permission denied should I "sudo touch .asoundrc"?
yeah
ok... nothing happened...
'ls -al', a .asoundrc should be created
i'm afraid not, i'm not that great at it :(
oh right... Yes I see it in the "ls -al" list, but I can't see the file when I look at the folder, even showing hidden files
So how can I go in and edit the file if I can't see it to click on?
if ls -al shows it's there, it's there
in the terminal, 'nano .asoundrc'
or use whichever text editor you like
I think it's in the wrong place - I need the file in /home/currentuser
hmm, try 'touch ~/.asoundrc' . i guess you created the file in the wrong folder
It's so wierd, I can't see .asoundrc
weird, if ls -al shows that it's there means it's created
ok this is embarrasing...I found it, sorry - was looking at folders not files (blush)
lol! okay.
Thanks for the help
no prob :)
